Name: Jacquard machine
Purpose: Early programmable machine for controlling looms
Significance: Introduced the concept of programmability

Name: Assembly
Purpose: Low-level programming language specific to computer architecture
Significance: Used for writing programs that directly interact with hardware

Name: FORTRAN
Chief developer, company: Team led by John W. Backus at IBM
Developer: Team led by John W. Backus at IBM
Purpose: Designed for scientific and engineering calculations
Significance: One of the oldest high-level programming languages

Name: BASIC
Chief developer, company: John George Kemeny, Thomas Eugene Kurtz at Dartmouth College
Developer: John George Kemeny, Thomas Eugene Kurtz at Dartmouth College
Purpose: Teaching programming to beginners
Significance: Easy-to-learn, widely used in education

Name: Pascal
Purpose: Teaching structured programming and data structuring
Significance: Promoted good programming practices

Name: SQL
Developer: Donald D. Chamberlin, Raymond F. Boyce at IBM
Purpose: Managing and manipulating relational databases
Significance: Standard language for database management

Name: C
Purpose: General-purpose programming language
Significance: Influential in the development of many other languages

Name: MATLAB
Chief developer, company: Cleve Moler at the University of New Mexico
Purpose: Numerical computing environment and programming language
Significance: Widely used for matrix computations, data visualization, and algorithm development

Name: C++
Purpose: Extension of C with object-oriented features
Significance: Widely used in software development

Name: Perl
Purpose: General-purpose, interpreted language
Significance: Strength in text processing and system administration

Name: Python
Purpose: General-purpose, high-level language
Significance: Known for simplicity and readability

Name: R
Purpose: Statistical computing and graphics
Significance: Widely used among statisticians and data miners

Name: JavaScript
Purpose: Making web pages interactive
Significance: Essential for web development

Name: Ruby
Purpose: Dynamic, object-oriented programming
Significance: Known for simplicity and productivity

Name: PHP
Purpose: Server-side scripting language
Significance: Widely used for dynamic web pages

Name: Java
Predecessor(s): C, Simula 67, C++, Smalltalk, Ada 83, Objective-C, Mesa
Developer: James Gosling and others at Sun Microsystems
Purpose: Class-based, object-oriented language
Significance: Widely used in web and mobile applications

Name: CSS
Chief developer, company: Håkon Wium Lie and Bert Bos
Purpose: Style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in HTML or XML
Significance: Essential for web design, separating content from design

Name: C#
Purpose: Multi-paradigm programming language developed for the Common Language Infrastructure
Significance: Widely used for developing Windows applications

Name: Scala
Predecessor(s): Smalltalk, Java, Haskell, Standard ML, OCaml
Purpose: General-purpose programming language providing support for functional programming and a strong static type system
Significance: Designed to be concise and to address criticisms of Java

Name: Go
Developer: Google, led by Robert Griesemer, Rob Pike, Ken Thompson
Purpose: Statically typed, compiled programming language designed for system programming
Significance: Known for its simplicity and efficiency

Name: Rust
Predecessor(s): Alef, C++, Camlp4, Erlang, Hermes, Limbo, Napier, Napier88, Newsqueak, NIL, Sather, Standard ML
Developer: Mozilla Research, led by Graydon Hoare
Purpose: Systems programming language focused on safety and performance
Significance: Known for its memory safety features

Name: Kotlin
Purpose: Modern multiplatform applications
Significance: Preferred language for Android app development

Name: TypeScript
Purpose: Superset of JavaScript that adds static typing
Significance: Improves development experience by catching errors early

Name: Swift
Predecessor(s): Objective-C, Rust, Haskell, Ruby, Python, C#, CLU
Purpose: Programming for Apple's platforms (macOS, iOS, watchOS, tvOS)
Significance: Designed for ease of use and performance
